page.title: 16The Doniford Stream
page.content: Flowing right across the middle of this Block is the{Doniford Stream. By the time it has reached the South of this area from its source high up on the{Brendon Hills}it has taken on all the characteristics of a river in middle age. For much of the year it winds and meanders peacefully through its narrow valley. However it drains large areas of upland both on the Brendon and Quantock Hills and this means after{heavy rain}the stream rapidly rises to the level of its banks. The colour of the stream in this spate is a bright reddish brown. There are a number of places within this block that are subject to {flooding}at such times, the water meadows at{Sampford Mill Farm}being aptly named.
